How many people are affected by ocular albinism ?,"The most common form of this disorder, ocular albinism type 1, affects at least 1 in 60,000 males. The classic signs and symptoms of this condition are much less common in females.",GHR,ocular albinism
What are the genetic changes related to ocular albinism ?,"Ocular albinism type 1 results from mutations in the GPR143 gene. This gene provides instructions for making a protein that plays a role in pigmentation of the eyes and skin. It help
